thread.title: Area Sports Briefs, 10/20/15

title: Area Sports Briefs, 10/20/15
text: Area Sports Briefs, 10/20/15 Junior college cross country -- RIVERSIDE, Calif. — Gilbert Kigen of Central Arizona took first out of 78 runners, and the Vaqueros finished second out seven teams in Saturday’s Highlander Invitational at UC Riverside. Kigen’s time for the 6-kilometer race was 17 minutes, 37.55 seconds. Jorge Perez took sixth in 17:53.59 and Brian Masayesva was seventh in 17:54.92. Also competing for CAC were Emmanuel Hildago (18:40.40), Timothy Ronan (18:45.24), Jordan Hellebuyck (18:45.36) and Randy Chavez (18:56.15). Marleena Eubanks was the top finisher for the CAC women, taking eighth with a 5K time of 18:07.93. Also competing for the Vaqueras, who were ninth out of 10 teams, were Marley Henson (18:43.81), Ramsey Chancellor (19:31.49), Jessica Shirley (19:33.68), Jelani Huma (19:41.76), Kaitlyn Volk (20:05.63) and Jessica Soto (21:51.23). High school football -- CASA GRANDE — Tyler Dreyer caught three touchdown passes for Mission Heights in Friday night’s 49-12 victory over Imagine Coolidge at Carr McNatt Park. Anthony Lopez had two TD catches, and Brandon Mitchell ran for two touchdowns and a two-point conversion as the Panthers improved their record to 3-5. Mario Montijo threw three TD passes and Lopez and Mitchell each had one. Emrullah Ceper kicked six extra points, and Garrett Hiller recovered two of Mission Heights’ onside kicks. Auto racing -- ELEVEN MILE CORNER — The top three finishers in Saturday night’s main events at Central Arizona Speedway: X-Mods: 1. Ron Schreiner, 2. Brandon Farrington, 3. Chuck Black. Supers: 1. Rob Coclasure, 2. Terry Churchwell, 3. Tommy Hussak. Bombers: 1. Steve Soboski, 2, Virgil McArthur, 3. Stuart Ballenger. Dwarfs: Cale Rudy, 2. Heather Henesey, 3. Tim Cotherman.
